required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 09, 2023
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.official_title: Development and Translation of Generator-Produced PET Tracer for Myocardial Perfusion Imaging

collaborator.agency: National Heart, Lung, and Blood Institute (NHLBI)

brief_summary.textblock: A single center, phase 0/1 clinical imaging study designed to assess the role of [68Ga]Galmydar PET/CT imaging in human subjects.

detailed_description.textblock: The primary objective of the proposed study is to evaluate the potential of [68Ga]Galmydar PET/CT MPI for the noninvasive detection of coronary artery disease. The study will evaluate [68Ga]Galmydar PET/CT MPI in comparison to [13N]ammonia PET/CT MPI to semi-quantitatively assess regional myocardial perfusion and quantitatively assess myocardial blood flow (MBF) in patients with suspected or known coronary artery disease (CAD) undergoing clinical SPECT MPI. In addition, perfusion and MBF findings with [68Ga]Galmydar will be compared to the results of coronary morphology or stenosis severity in those patients undergoing invasive coronary angiography (ICA) based on abnormal SPECT MPI. The performance of rest/stress [68Ga]Galmydar PET/CT in comparison to [13N]ammonia PET/CT in normal subjects without cardiovascular disease will be performed as a control. The primary objective of the proposed study is to evaluate the potential of [68Ga]Galmydar PET/CT MPI for the noninvasive detection of coronary artery disease. The study will evaluate [68Ga]Galmydar PET/CT MPI in comparison to [13N]ammonia PET/CT MPI in the same subjects to semi quantitatively assess regional myocardial perfusion and quantitatively assess myocardial blood flow (MBF) in patients with suspected or known coronary artery disease (CAD) undergoing clinical SPECT MPI. In addition, perfusion and MBF findings with [68Ga]Galmydar will be compared to the results of coronary morphology or stenosis severity in those patients undergoing invasive coronary angiography (ICA) based on abnormal SPECT MPI. The performance of rest/stress [68Ga]Galmydar PET/CT in comparison to [13N]ammonia PET/CT in normal subjects without cardiovascular disease will be performed as a control. Vital signs, serum chemistries, and serum blood counts will also be obtained.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: Patients with known or suspected disease and normal controls (no known disease) will both undergo [68Ga]Galmydar PET/CT MPI and [13N]ammonia PET/CT MPI

primary_outcome.time_frame: Comparison to regional uptake on 13N-ammonia PET/CT performed 3-30 days after the 68Ga-Galmydar PET/CT
primary_outcome.description: Assessment of regional (17segment) myocardial uptake on 5-point scale (0 = normal; 4 = absent tracer uptake) per independent blind readout by 3 expert cardiac PET physicians.

secondary_outcome.measure: Assessment of myocardial blood flow on 68Ga-Galmydar PET/CT
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Comparison to regional MBF on 13N-ammonia PET/CT performed 3-30 days after the 68Ga-Galmydar PET/CT
secondary_outcome.description: Assessment of regional (17segment) myocardial blood flow (MBF) at stress and rest perfusion on 68Ga-Galmydar PET/CT.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in systolic or diastolic blood pressure.
secondary_outcome.description: A 20 mmHg change from baseline in either systolic or diastolic blood pressure.
A 20 BPM change in heart rate from baseline.

secondary_outcome.measure: Clinically significant change in respiratory rate.
secondary_outcome.description: A respiratory rate of < 12 or > 20 breaths/min.

secondary_outcome.measure: Clinically significant elevation in oral temperature
Number of patients with new AV Block
secondary_outcome.description: A change in EKG showing new AV Block (Type 1 or Type 2), Mobitz 2:1, or QTc ≥ 500ms).

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of patients with new bradycardia
secondary_outcome.description: New heart rate < 40 BPM on EKG.

secondary_outcome.measure: Clinically significant change in serum chemistries: sodium, potassium, chloride, CO2
secondary_outcome.description: Serum chemistries (sodium, potassium, chloride, CO2) measured in mmol/L. Values outside of laboratory range in comparison to baseline or >20% difference from baseline values.

secondary_outcome.measure: Clinically significant change in serum chemistries: glucose, calcium creatinine, BUN, total bilirubin
secondary_outcome.description: Serum chemistries (glucose, calcium creatinine, BUN, total bilirubin), measured in mg/dL. Values outside of laboratory range in comparison to baseline or >20% difference from baseline values.

secondary_outcome.measure: Clinically significant change in serum chemistries: total protein, albumin.
secondary_outcome.description: Serum chemistries (total protein, albumin), measured in g/dL. Values outside of laboratory range in comparison to baseline or >20% difference from baseline values.

secondary_outcome.measure: Clinically significant change in serum chemistries: alkaline phosphatase, ALT, AST
secondary_outcome.description: Serum chemistries (alkaline phosphatase), measured in U/L. Values outside of laboratory range in comparison to baseline or >20% difference from baseline values.

secondary_outcome.measure: Clinically significant change in white blood cell count (WBC)
secondary_outcome.description: White blood cell count measured in WBC/mm3 blood. Values outside of laboratory range in comparison to baseline or >20% difference from baseline values.
Hgb measured in g/dL. Values outside of laboratory range in comparison to baseline or >20% difference from baseline values.
Hct measured in %. Values outside of laboratory range in comparison to baseline or >20% difference from baseline values.
Platelets measured in platelets/mm3 blood. Values outside of laboratory range in comparison to baseline or >20% difference from baseline values.

secondary_outcome.measure: Clinically significant change in red blood cell count (RBC)
secondary_outcome.description: RBC measured in million/mm3. Values outside of laboratory range in comparison to baseline or >20% difference from baseline values.

secondary_outcome.measure: Clinically significant change in mean corpuscular volume (MCV)
secondary_outcome.description: MCV measured in µm3. Values outside of laboratory range in comparison to baseline or >20% difference from baseline values.

arm_group.description: Participants will receive two [68Ga]Galmydar intravenous administrations, 4 mCi during rest and 8 mCi during stress for the PET MPI performed on Imaging Day-1.
On Imaging Day-2, participants will receive two single administrations each of 10 mCi of 13N-Ammonia during the rest and stress PET MPI.

intervention.description: Two intravenous injection of the PET radiotracer 68Ga-Galmydar.
Two intravenous Injection of PET radiotracer 13N-Ammonia.

reference.citation: Sivapackiam J, Laforest R, Sharma V. 68Ga[Ga]-Galmydar: Biodistribution and radiation dosimetry studies in rodents. Nucl Med Biol. 2018 Apr;59:29-35. doi: 10.1016/j.nucmedbio.2017.11.008. Epub 2017 Dec 1.

responsible_party.investigator_title: H M Wilson Professor of Radiology
